name: Federation of European Heating, Ventilation and Air-conditioning Associations
goal:
REHVA, the Federation of European Heating, Ventilation and Air-conditioning Associations, established in 1963, is an independent, pan-European, professional association representing more than 120.000 building services engineers and HVAC professionals from 27 European countries. REHVA member associations are national federations of building services engineers.

REHVA is dedicated to the improvement of health, comfort and energy efficiency in all buildings and communities. It encourages the development and application of both energy conservation and renewable energy sources. In these areas, REHVA has a significant impact on national and international strategic planning and research initiatives, as well as on the associated educational and training programmes. REHVA provides networking and cooperation opportunities for its member associations and supporters and creates links to the EU institutions, as well as European and international organizations, sharing the similar goals in the building sector.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Consumers, Energy, Environment, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
REHVA is advocating for indoor environment quality and buildings energy efficiency, and aims at contributing to the development of buildings related EU policies and at supporting their national level implementation in the field of HVAC. REHVA focuses on the following main policy issues in :
- Energy Union
- EPBD and EED review
- Ecodesign and Energy labelling updates
- Standardisation: CEN liaison activities and follow-up of EPBD related standards
- European Voluntary Building Certification scheme for non-residential buildings
- EU energy research roadmap (SET Plan, Horizon 2020, joint research initiatives, technology platforms)
